moves.1. e4: B00 King's Pawn Opening. The most popular opening.
moves.2. Nf3: C40 King's Knight Opening. This is the most logical second move against Black's symmetrical answer to the King's Pawn.
moves.4. Qh5+: C40 Damiano Defense. Now black is in trouble. g6 is a blunder and will lose a rook.
moves.4... Ke7: C40 Damiano Defense. This opening is a hell for black. A small mistake will lose the game.
moves.5. Qxe5+: C40 Damiano Defense. Black is forced to move his King to f7.
moves.6. Bc4+: C40 Damiano Defense. Now black is in deep trouble. 2 possible moves exist, d5 and Kg6.
moves.6... Kg6: C40 Damiano Defense. Ouch... I don't know what kind of opening this is!!! Black moves into forced mate.
moves.7. Qf5+: C40 Damiano Defense. Black is forced to move the King to h6.
moves.8. d3+: still the bloody C40 Damiano Defense.
moves.9. h4: Great!!! This is the key to victory for white. Forced mate now looks more obvious.
moves.9... Bb4+: Now it does not really matter what black is willing to do!
moves.10. Ke2 Qe7: There is no better move for black. Any other move will end the game by Qxg5#
moves.13... Kh6: Forced. Moves it out of check.
moves.14. Qf6+ Ng6 15. h5: Another good move from white. The game is over.
moves.15... d6: Delays the forced mate for one move.
